result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler S. Fashun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete domestic abuse counseling and anger management counseling. Pay restitution to the victim in an amount she requests. Serve 30 days conditional time in the Richland County Jail, with huber. Jail is stayed for up to 60 days; probation agent to determine when the condition time is served. Court orders all court costs remitted as the Defendant has other financial obligations, namely child support, that the Court wants as his priority. Credit set at 0 but still open and yet-to-be-determined by counsel with counsel's research on credit due to the Court within 30 days.
Concurrent with: 16CF9

timeConds.notes:
With huber. Stayed for up to 60 days with start to be determined by the agent.
Concurrent with: Counts in this case concurrent with each other and with 16CF9.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Defendant Tyler S. Fashun in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Five cases called together:

17CF7 and 17CF10, arraignment

15CM177/count 1, sentencing after revocation
15CM179/counts 2 and 3, sentencing after revocation
16CF9, counts 1 and 2, sentencing after revocation

DA Harper offers the following as the proposed resolution for four of the cases cases:  6 months jail with 107 days credit for the revoked counts in 15CM177, 15CM179, and 16CF9.  In 17CF7, the proposed resolution for count 2 is 9 months jail, imposed and stayed for 2 years probation; for count 3, the proposal calls for 90 days jail, imposed and stayed for 2 years probation; jail to be consecutive in 17CF7 and the probation to be consecutive to the sentences in 15CM177, 15CM179, and 16CF9.  Harper states that counsel will ask to hold open 17CF10.

Sentence after revocation on revoked counts in 15CM177, 15CM179 and 16CF9:
Court orders 6 months jail on each count, concurrent with each other and with 107 days credit.

Colloquy conducted in 17CF7. Def pleads no contest to counts 2 and 3. Court's colloquy on pleas.

17CF7 sentence ordered as follows:
9 months jail on count 2 with huber/work release
90 days on count 3 with huber/work release, consecutive
This jail is imposed/stayed for 2 years probation, consecutive to the sentences the Def has now been ordered to serve in the 3 revocation cases.
Conditions of probation: attend, pay for, and successfully complete domestic abuse programming (24 or 26 week); attend, pay for, and complete any counseling or educational programs; obey rules/regulations of probation; 0 days credit.
Count 1 dismissed/read in.

17CF10
Counsel ask to hold this matter open for now with next hearing after jail is done in the revoked matters. Court sets 5/25 at 1:15.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 26, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
#1-#4 - photos

Defendant Tyler S. Fashun in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM40, 15CM179, 16CF9, 15FO166, and not-yet-filed felony bail jumping matter called together.  DA Harper informs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution of all but the uncharged felony bail jumping.  Per Harper, agreement calls for def's pleas to counts 2 and 3/battery and criminal dam. to property in 15CM179 and counts 1 and 2 as amended to mis. theft in 16CF9; 15CM40, remaining criminal counts, and 15FO166 to be dismissed/read in.

Def pleads no contest to the charges stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Victim addresses the Court.  DA addresses the Court.  Atty. McDougal addresses the Court.  Def addresses the Court.

Sentence:

15CM179, Counts 2 and 3 - withheld for probation of 2 years.  Conditions:  attend, pay for, and successfully complete d.a. counseling and anger mgt counseling; pay restitution to the victim in an amount she requests; 30 days jail.  Jail stayed for up to 60 days - probation agent to determine when that conditional time is served.  Court orders court costs remitted.  Huber on the conditional jail.

16CF9, Counts 1 and 2 - same sentence as 15CM179, concurrent.  

Credit set at 0 but matter still open and yet-to-be-determined further - counsel to research.  Court orders counsel to submit credit info within 30 days.

16CM40 DRI.  Counts 1, 4, and 5 in 15CM179 DRI.  Count 3 in 16CM9 DRI. 15FO166 DRI.
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

All cases called together (15FO166,16CF9,15CM40,15CM177, 15CM179). Defendant Tyler S. Fashun in court in custody from the RC jail, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA moves to sentence def. in case 15CM177 to count 1, Bail Jump, Misdemeanor.  Defendant pleas Guilty to count 1.  The rest of the counts will be dismissed and read in.  Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of Guilty.
Sentence:  Withhold sentence for 2 years probation on count 1.  All other counts are dismissed.
Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment or eductional programs ordered by his agent; AODA assessment; and follow through with the recommendations; Contact with Brettlyn Harvell at discretion of agent and costs of the action be reduced to civil judgment. Counts 2 through 7 are dismissed and read in for purposes of jeapardy.  0 credits.
Court orders to enter JOC.
Other cases are scheduled for 12/14/16 at 3:30pm.
Status conference on December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
